Module contents¶

class nnetsauce.AdaBoostClassifier(obj, n_estimators=10, learning_rate=0.1, n_hidden_features=1, reg_lambda=0, reg_alpha=0.5, activation_name='relu', a=0.01, nodes_sim='sobol', bias=True, dropout=0, direct_link=False, n_clusters=2, cluster_encode=True, type_clust='kmeans', type_scaling=('std', 'std', 'std'), col_sample=1, row_sample=1, seed=123, verbose=1, method='SAMME')¶

Bases: nnetsauce.boosting.bst.Boosting, sklearn.base.ClassifierMixin

AdaBoost Classification (SAMME) model class derived from class Boosting

obj: object

any object containing a method fit (obj.fit()) and a method predict (obj.predict())

n_estimators: int

number of boosting iterations

learning_rate: float

learning rate of the boosting procedure

n_hidden_features: int

number of nodes in the hidden layer

reg_lambda: float

regularization parameter for weights

reg_alpha: float

controls compromize between l1 and l2 norm of weights

activation_name: str

activation function: ‘relu’, ‘tanh’, ‘sigmoid’, ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’

a: float

hyperparameter for ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’ activation function

nodes_sim: str

type of simulation for the nodes: ‘sobol’, ‘hammersley’, ‘halton’, ‘uniform’

bias: boolean

indicates if the hidden layer contains a bias term (True) or not (False)

dropout: float

regularization parameter; (random) percentage of nodes dropped out of the training

direct_link: boolean

indicates if the original predictors are included (True) in model’s fitting or not (False)

n_clusters: int
number of clusters for ‘kmeans’ or ‘gmm’ clustering (could be 0:

no clustering)

cluster_encode: bool

defines how the variable containing clusters is treated (default is one-hot) if False, then labels are used, without one-hot encoding

type_clust: str

type of clustering method: currently k-means (‘kmeans’) or Gaussian Mixture Model (‘gmm’)

type_scaling: a tuple of 3 strings

scaling methods for inputs, hidden layer, and clustering respectively (and when relevant). Currently available: standardization (‘std’) or MinMax scaling (‘minmax’)

col_sample: float

percentage of covariates randomly chosen for training

row_sample: float

percentage of rows chosen for training, by stratified bootstrapping

seed: int

reproducibility seed for nodes_sim==’uniform’

method: str

type of Adaboost method, ‘SAMME’ (discrete) or ‘SAMME.R’ (real)

fit(X, y, sample_weight=None, **kwargs)¶

Fit Boosting model to training data (X, y).

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features.

y: array-like, shape = [n_samples]

Target values.

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to

self.cook_training_set or self.obj.fit

self: object

predict(X, **kwargs)¶

Predict test data X.

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features.

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to

self.cook_test_set

model predictions: {array-like}

predict_proba(X, **kwargs)¶

Predict probabilities for test data X.

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features.

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to

self.cook_test_set

probability estimates for test data: {array-like}

score(X, y, scoring=None, **kwargs)¶

Score the model on test set features X and response y.

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features

y: array-like, shape = [n_samples]

Target values

scoring: str

must be in (‘explained_variance’, ‘neg_mean_absolute_error’, ‘neg_mean_squared_error’, ‘neg_mean_squared_log_error’, ‘neg_median_absolute_error’, ‘r2’)

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to scoring functions

model scores: {array-like}

class nnetsauce.Base(n_hidden_features=5, activation_name='relu', a=0.01, nodes_sim='sobol', bias=True, dropout=0, direct_link=True, n_clusters=2, cluster_encode=True, type_clust='kmeans', type_scaling=('std', 'std', 'std'), col_sample=1, row_sample=1, seed=123)¶

Bases: sklearn.base.BaseEstimator

Base model from which all the other classes inherit. Contains mainly data preprocessing methods.

n_hidden_features: int

number of nodes in the hidden layer

activation_name: str

activation function: ‘relu’, ‘tanh’, ‘sigmoid’, ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’

a: float

hyperparameter for ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’ activation function

nodes_sim: str

type of simulation for hidden layer nodes: ‘sobol’, ‘hammersley’, ‘halton’, ‘uniform’

bias: boolean

indicates if the hidden layer contains a bias term (True) or not (False)

dropout: float

regularization parameter; (random) percentage of nodes dropped out of the training

direct_link: boolean

indicates if the original features are included (True) in model’s fitting or not (False)

n_clusters: int

number of clusters for type_clust=’kmeans’ or type_clust=’gmm’ clustering (could be 0: no clustering)

cluster_encode: bool

defines how the variable containing clusters is treated (default is one-hot); if False, then labels are used, without one-hot encoding

type_clust: str

type of clustering method: currently k-means (‘kmeans’) or Gaussian Mixture Model (‘gmm’)

type_scaling: a tuple of 3 strings

scaling methods for inputs, hidden layer, and clustering respectively (and when relevant). Currently available: standardization (‘std’) or MinMax scaling (‘minmax’)

col_sample: float

percentage of features randomly chosen for training

row_sample: float

percentage of rows chosen for training, by stratified bootstrapping

seed: int

reproducibility seed for nodes_sim==’uniform’, clustering and dropout

cook_test_set(X, **kwargs)¶

Transform data from test set, with hidden layer.

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to self.encode_cluster

Transformed test set : {array-like}

cook_training_set(y=None, X=None, W=None, **kwargs)¶

Create new hidden features for training set, with hidden layer, center the response.

y: array-like, shape = [n_samples]

Target values

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features

W: {array-like}, shape = [n_features, hidden_features]

if provided, constructs the hidden layer via W

(centered response, direct link + hidden layer matrix): {tuple}

create_layer(scaled_X, W=None)¶

Create hidden layer.

scaled_X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features

W: {array-like}, shape = [n_features, hidden_features]

if provided, constructs the hidden layer with W; otherwise computed internally

Hidden layer matrix: {array-like}

encode_clusters(X=None, predict=False, **kwargs)¶

Create new covariates with kmeans or GMM clustering

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features.

predict: boolean

is False on training set and True on test set

**kwargs:

additional parameters to be passed to the clustering method

Clusters’ matrix, one-hot encoded: {array-like}

class nnetsauce.BaseRegressor(n_hidden_features=5, activation_name='relu', a=0.01, nodes_sim='sobol', bias=True, dropout=0, direct_link=True, n_clusters=2, cluster_encode=True, type_clust='kmeans', type_scaling=('std', 'std', 'std'), col_sample=1, row_sample=1, seed=123)¶

Bases: nnetsauce.base.base.Base, sklearn.base.RegressorMixin

Random Vector Functional Link Network regression without shrinkage

n_hidden_features: int

number of nodes in the hidden layer

activation_name: str

activation function: ‘relu’, ‘tanh’, ‘sigmoid’, ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’

a: float

hyperparameter for ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’ activation function

nodes_sim: str

type of simulation for hidden layer nodes: ‘sobol’, ‘hammersley’, ‘halton’, ‘uniform’

bias: boolean

indicates if the hidden layer contains a bias term (True) or not (False)

dropout: float

regularization parameter; (random) percentage of nodes dropped out of the training

direct_link: boolean

indicates if the original features are included (True) in model’s fitting or not (False)

n_clusters: int

number of clusters for type_clust=’kmeans’ or type_clust=’gmm’ clustering (could be 0: no clustering)

cluster_encode: bool

defines how the variable containing clusters is treated (default is one-hot); if False, then labels are used, without one-hot encoding

type_clust: str

type of clustering method: currently k-means (‘kmeans’) or Gaussian Mixture Model (‘gmm’)

type_scaling: a tuple of 3 strings

scaling methods for inputs, hidden layer, and clustering respectively (and when relevant). Currently available: standardization (‘std’) or MinMax scaling (‘minmax’)

col_sample: float

percentage of features randomly chosen for training

row_sample: float

percentage of rows chosen for training, by stratified bootstrapping

seed: int

reproducibility seed for nodes_sim==’uniform’, clustering and dropout

fit(X, y, **kwargs)¶

Fit BaseRegressor to training data (X, y)

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features

y: array-like, shape = [n_samples]

Target values

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to self.cook_training_set

self: object

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to self.cook_test_set

model predictions: {array-like}

Target values

scoring: str

must be in (‘explained_variance’, ‘neg_mean_absolute_error’, ‘neg_mean_squared_error’, ‘neg_mean_squared_log_error’, ‘neg_median_absolute_error’, ‘r2’)

model scores: {array-like}

class nnetsauce.BayesianRVFLRegressor(n_hidden_features=5, activation_name='relu', a=0.01, nodes_sim='sobol', bias=True, dropout=0, direct_link=True, n_clusters=2, cluster_encode=True, type_clust='kmeans', type_scaling=('std', 'std', 'std'), col_sample=1, row_sample=1, seed=123, s=0.1, sigma=0.05, beta=None, Sigma=None, GCV=None, return_std=True)¶

Bases: nnetsauce.base.base.Base, sklearn.base.RegressorMixin

Bayesian Random Vector Functional Link Network regression with one prior

n_hidden_features: int

number of nodes in the hidden layer

activation_name: str

activation function: ‘relu’, ‘tanh’, ‘sigmoid’, ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’

a: float

hyperparameter for ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’ activation function

nodes_sim: str

type of simulation for the nodes: ‘sobol’, ‘hammersley’, ‘halton’, ‘uniform’

bias: boolean

indicates if the hidden layer contains a bias term (True) or not (False)

dropout: float

regularization parameter; (random) percentage of nodes dropped out of the training

direct_link: boolean

indicates if the original features are included (True) in model’s fitting or not (False)

n_clusters: int

number of clusters for ‘kmeans’ or ‘gmm’ clustering (could be 0: no clustering)

cluster_encode: bool

defines how the variable containing clusters is treated (default is one-hot) if False, then labels are used, without one-hot encoding

type_clust: str

type of clustering method: currently k-means (‘kmeans’) or Gaussian Mixture Model (‘gmm’)

type_scaling: a tuple of 3 strings

scaling methods for inputs, hidden layer, and clustering respectively (and when relevant). Currently available: standardization (‘std’) or MinMax scaling (‘minmax’)

col_sample: float

percentage of features randomly chosen for training

row_sample: float

percentage of rows chosen for training, by stratified bootstrapping

seed: int

reproducibility seed for nodes_sim==’uniform’

s: float

std. dev. of regression parameters in Bayesian Ridge Regression

sigma: float

std. dev. of residuals in Bayesian Ridge Regression

beta: array-like

regression’s fitted parameters

Sigma: array-like

covariance of the distribution of fitted parameters

GCV: float return_std: boolean

fit(X, y, **kwargs)¶

Fit BayesianRVFLRegressor to training data (X, y).

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features.

y: array-like, shape = [n_samples]

Target values.

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to

self.cook_training_set

self: object

predict(X, return_std=False, **kwargs)¶

Predict test data X.

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features.

return_std: {boolean}, standard dev. is returned or not **kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to

self.cook_test_set

model predictions: {array-like}

score(X, y, scoring=None, **kwargs)¶

Score the model on test set features X and response y.

Target values

scoring: str

must be in (‘explained_variance’, ‘neg_mean_absolute_error’, ‘neg_mean_squared_error’, ‘neg_mean_squared_log_error’, ‘neg_median_absolute_error’, ‘r2’)

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to scoring functions

model scores: {array-like}

class nnetsauce.BayesianRVFL2Regressor(n_hidden_features=5, activation_name='relu', a=0.01, nodes_sim='sobol', bias=True, dropout=0, direct_link=True, n_clusters=0, cluster_encode=True, type_clust='kmeans', type_scaling=('std', 'std', 'std'), col_sample=1, row_sample=1, seed=123, s1=0.1, s2=0.1, sigma=0.05, beta=None, Sigma=None, GCV=None, return_std=True)¶

Bases: nnetsauce.base.base.Base, sklearn.base.RegressorMixin

Bayesian Random Vector Functional Link Network regression with two priors

n_hidden_features: int

number of nodes in the hidden layer

activation_name: str

activation function: ‘relu’, ‘tanh’, ‘sigmoid’, ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’

a: float

hyperparameter for ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’ activation function

nodes_sim: str

type of simulation for the nodes: ‘sobol’, ‘hammersley’, ‘halton’, ‘uniform’

bias: boolean

indicates if the hidden layer contains a bias term (True) or not (False)

dropout: float

regularization parameter; (random) percentage of nodes dropped out of the training

direct_link: boolean

indicates if the original features are included (True) in model’s fitting or not (False)

n_clusters: int

number of clusters for ‘kmeans’ or ‘gmm’ clustering (could be 0: no clustering)

cluster_encode: bool

defines how the variable containing clusters is treated (default is one-hot) if False, then labels are used, without one-hot encoding

type_clust: str

type of clustering method: currently k-means (‘kmeans’) or Gaussian Mixture Model (‘gmm’)

type_scaling: a tuple of 3 strings

scaling methods for inputs, hidden layer, and clustering respectively (and when relevant). Currently available: standardization (‘std’) or MinMax scaling (‘minmax’)

col_sample: float

percentage of features randomly chosen for training

row_sample: float

percentage of rows chosen for training, by stratified bootstrapping

seed: int

reproducibility seed for nodes_sim==’uniform’

s1: float

std. dev. of init. regression parameters in Bayesian Ridge Regression

s2: float

std. dev. of augmented regression parameters in Bayesian Ridge Regression

sigma: float

std. dev. of residuals in Bayesian Ridge Regression

beta: array-like

regression’s fitted parameters

Sigma: array-like

covariance of the distribution of fitted parameters

GCV: float return_std: boolean

class nnetsauce.CustomClassifier(obj, n_hidden_features=5, activation_name='relu', a=0.01, nodes_sim='sobol', bias=True, dropout=0, direct_link=True, n_clusters=2, cluster_encode=True, type_clust='kmeans', type_scaling=('std', 'std', 'std'), col_sample=1, row_sample=1, seed=123)¶

Bases: nnetsauce.custom.custom.Custom, sklearn.base.ClassifierMixin

Custom Classification model

obj: object

any object containing a method fit (obj.fit()) and a method predict (obj.predict())

n_hidden_features: int

number of nodes in the hidden layer

activation_name: str

activation function: ‘relu’, ‘tanh’, ‘sigmoid’, ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’

a: float

hyperparameter for ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’ activation function

nodes_sim: str

type of simulation for the nodes: ‘sobol’, ‘hammersley’, ‘halton’, ‘uniform’

bias: boolean

indicates if the hidden layer contains a bias term (True) or not (False)

dropout: float

regularization parameter; (random) percentage of nodes dropped out of the training

direct_link: boolean

indicates if the original predictors are included (True) in model’s fitting or not (False)

n_clusters: int
number of clusters for ‘kmeans’ or ‘gmm’ clustering (could be 0:

no clustering)

cluster_encode: bool

defines how the variable containing clusters is treated (default is one-hot) if False, then labels are used, without one-hot encoding

type_clust: str

type of clustering method: currently k-means (‘kmeans’) or Gaussian Mixture Model (‘gmm’)

type_scaling: a tuple of 3 strings

scaling methods for inputs, hidden layer, and clustering respectively (and when relevant). Currently available: standardization (‘std’) or MinMax scaling (‘minmax’)

col_sample: float

percentage of covariates randomly chosen for training

row_sample: float

percentage of rows chosen for training, by stratified bootstrapping

seed: int

reproducibility seed for nodes_sim==’uniform’

class nnetsauce.CustomRegressor(obj, n_hidden_features=5, activation_name='relu', a=0.01, nodes_sim='sobol', bias=True, dropout=0, direct_link=True, n_clusters=2, cluster_encode=True, type_clust='kmeans', type_scaling=('std', 'std', 'std'), col_sample=1, row_sample=1, seed=123)¶

Bases: nnetsauce.custom.custom.Custom, sklearn.base.RegressorMixin

Custom Regression model

obj: object

any object containing a method fit (obj.fit()) and a method predict (obj.predict())

n_hidden_features: int

number of nodes in the hidden layer

activation_name: str

activation function: ‘relu’, ‘tanh’, ‘sigmoid’, ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’

a: float

hyperparameter for ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’ activation function

nodes_sim: str

type of simulation for the nodes: ‘sobol’, ‘hammersley’, ‘halton’, ‘uniform’

bias: boolean

indicates if the hidden layer contains a bias term (True) or not (False)

dropout: float

regularization parameter; (random) percentage of nodes dropped out of the training

direct_link: boolean

indicates if the original predictors are included (True) in model’s fitting or not (False)

n_clusters: int
number of clusters for ‘kmeans’ or ‘gmm’ clustering (could be 0:

no clustering)

cluster_encode: bool

defines how the variable containing clusters is treated (default is one-hot) if False, then labels are used, without one-hot encoding

type_clust: str

type of clustering method: currently k-means (‘kmeans’) or Gaussian Mixture Model (‘gmm’)

type_scaling: a tuple of 3 strings

scaling methods for inputs, hidden layer, and clustering respectively (and when relevant). Currently available: standardization (‘std’) or MinMax scaling (‘minmax’)

col_sample: float

percentage of covariates randomly chosen for training

row_sample: float

percentage of rows chosen for training, by stratified bootstrapping

seed: int

reproducibility seed for nodes_sim==’uniform’

type_fit: str

‘regression’

score(X, y, scoring=None, **kwargs)¶

Score the model on test set features X and response y.

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features

y: array-like, shape = [n_samples]

Target values

scoring: str

must be in (‘explained_variance’, ‘neg_mean_absolute_error’, ‘neg_mean_squared_error’, ‘neg_mean_squared_log_error’, ‘neg_median_absolute_error’, ‘r2’)

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to scoring functions

model scores: {array-like}

class nnetsauce.MultitaskClassifier(obj, n_hidden_features=5, activation_name='relu', a=0.01, nodes_sim='sobol', bias=True, dropout=0, direct_link=True, n_clusters=2, cluster_encode=True, type_clust='kmeans', type_scaling=('std', 'std', 'std'), col_sample=1, row_sample=1, seed=123)¶

Bases: nnetsauce.base.base.Base, sklearn.base.ClassifierMixin

Multitask Classification model based on regression models, with shared covariates

obj: object

any object (must be a regression model) containing a method fit (obj.fit()) and a method predict (obj.predict())

n_hidden_features: int

number of nodes in the hidden layer

activation_name: str

activation function: ‘relu’, ‘tanh’, ‘sigmoid’, ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’

a: float

hyperparameter for ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’ activation function

nodes_sim: str

type of simulation for the nodes: ‘sobol’, ‘hammersley’, ‘halton’, ‘uniform’

bias: boolean

indicates if the hidden layer contains a bias term (True) or not (False)

dropout: float

regularization parameter; (random) percentage of nodes dropped out of the training

direct_link: boolean

indicates if the original predictors are included (True) in model’s fitting or not (False)

n_clusters: int
number of clusters for ‘kmeans’ or ‘gmm’ clustering (could be 0:

no clustering)

cluster_encode: bool

defines how the variable containing clusters is treated (default is one-hot) if False, then labels are used, without one-hot encoding

type_clust: str

type of clustering method: currently k-means (‘kmeans’) or Gaussian Mixture Model (‘gmm’)

type_scaling: a tuple of 3 strings

scaling methods for inputs, hidden layer, and clustering respectively (and when relevant). Currently available: standardization (‘std’) or MinMax scaling (‘minmax’)

col_sample: float

percentage of covariates randomly chosen for training

row_sample: float

percentage of rows chosen for training, by stratified bootstrapping

seed: int

reproducibility seed for nodes_sim==’uniform’

fit(X, y, sample_weight=None, **kwargs)¶

Fit MultitaskClassifier to training data (X, y).

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features.

y: array-like, shape = [n_samples]

Target values.

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to

self.cook_training_set or self.obj.fit

self: object

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to

self.cook_test_set

model predictions: {array-like}

activation function: ‘relu’, ‘tanh’, ‘sigmoid’, ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’

indicates if the hidden layer contains a bias term (True) or not (False)

regularization parameter; (random) percentage of nodes dropped out of the training

no clustering)

cluster_encode: bool

defines how the variable containing clusters is treated (default is one-hot) if False, then labels are used, without one-hot encoding

type_clust: str

type of clustering method: currently k-means (‘kmeans’) or Gaussian Mixture Model (‘gmm’)

percentage of rows chosen for training, by stratified bootstrapping

regularization parameter on direct link

lambda2: float

regularization parameter on hidden layer

reproducibility seed for nodes_sim==’uniform’

Bases: nnetsauce.base.base.Base

MTS model class derived from class Base

obj: object

any object containing a method fit (obj.fit()) and a method predict (obj.predict())

number of nodes in the hidden layer

activation_name: str

activation function: ‘relu’, ‘tanh’, ‘sigmoid’, ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’

a: float

hyperparameter for ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’ activation function

nodes_sim: str

type of simulation for the nodes: ‘sobol’, ‘hammersley’, ‘halton’, ‘uniform’

bias: boolean

indicates if the hidden layer contains a bias term (True) or not (False)

dropout: float

regularization parameter; (random) percentage of nodes dropped out of the training

direct_link: boolean

indicates if the original predictors are included (True) in model’s fitting or not (False)

n_clusters: int

number of clusters for ‘kmeans’ or ‘gmm’ clustering (could be 0: no clustering)

cluster_encode: bool

defines how the variable containing clusters is treated (default is one-hot) if False, then labels are used, without one-hot encoding

type_clust: str

type of clustering method: currently k-means (‘kmeans’) or Gaussian Mixture Model (‘gmm’)

number of lags used for each time series

fit(X, xreg=None, **kwargs)¶

Fit MTS model to training data X, with optional regressors xreg

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training time series, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features; X must be in increasing order (most recent observations last)

xreg: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features_xreg]

Additional regressors to be passed to obj xreg must be in increasing order (most recent observations last)

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to

self.cook_training_set

self: object

predict(h=5, level=95, new_xreg=None, **kwargs)¶

Forecast all the time series, h steps ahead

h: {integer}

Forecasting horizon

level: {integer}

Level of confidence (if obj has option ‘return_std’ and the posterior is gaussian)

new_xreg: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples = h, n_new_xreg]

New values of additional (deterministic) regressors on horizon = h new_xreg must be in increasing order (most recent observations last)

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to

self.cook_test_set

model predictions for horizon = h: {array-like}

score(X, training_index, testing_index, scoring=None, **kwargs)¶

Train on training_index, score on testing_index.
